IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we need to connect a new substation to the network for electric vehicle electricity supplies. This equipment controls and delivers electricity into your area. This work is being carried out at night to minimise disruption due to traffic management requirements on site. To connect the new equipment and complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off. Once completed this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in your area and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. This work is taking place on Thorney Way.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine 2 transformers on our electricity poles to check they are functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Butchers Lane and Homefield.

A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Kevin, Lisa, Stuart and Dave are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.

Steps.Message: Following on from our previous message, we can now confirm we have switched power off. This is to allow our engineers to safely excavate and repair a faulty underground cable. We're now estimating to have the power back on between 19:30 and 20:30. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry to say we may need to turn the power off again in this area. Our engineers have found another fault on the underground network which will need to be excavated and repaired. We'll work as quickly and safely as possible to get everything back on once the repairs are complete.

With darkness now upon us we understand that it can be unsettling to have a power cut. It may help to locate a torch and anything else you may need so you can have it to hand just in case.

If you have any concerns please do not hesitate to contact our team, but we will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible. Sent by Roland at 18:09.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 18:39 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repair a fault on the underground network in the Cherry Hinton Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. The customer support vehicle has stood down and further repairs will be carried out.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power for a long time can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 16:50 - Our engineers have advised us that in order to continue their works on the underground fault safely, they have had to turn off power to further properties in the area. Our estimated time of 20:30-21:30 hasn't changed. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that they have located faulty overhead equipment which they are now working to repair.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 20:30-21:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Decasta at 17:41.

We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 17:34 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 13:25 - We can now confirm that all power in the Hook Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by a piece of faulty underground  equipment, which our engineers have replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive to locate and fix the underground equipment fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Lisa at 12:20.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 10:21 - Thanks for bearing with us, we know being without power can be frustrating. I'll be on hand to update you as our staff work on repairs, and I just wanted to give you the latest from site.

Our staff have been in contact with us and advised they need assistance from further staff. They are working to check smaller sites along our network, known as link boxes. These have very heavy metal lids, and for safety our engineer needs further staff to help.

To allow time for further staff to arrive and for any repairs to be made, we're now estimating power will be on by 18:00 and 19:00. I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 10:00 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 31 customers in the Sharp Road area, by diverting power around the underground network fault. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 09:38 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our underground cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Engineers have arrived on site in the Sharp Road area to investigate an underground network fault currently affecting 31 properties. Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

Using an average timescale for this type of issue we're looking to have you back on between 10:30 and 11:30, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We'll continue to update you with all of our progress.

Sent by Adam at 09:13.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
